description: From Hindustani لشکر‎ / लश्कर (laśkar), from Persian لشکر‎ (laškar).

entries.meaning: (now chiefly historical) A sailor from India or Southeast Asia, especially as serving on a European ship.
examples: As for the voyage itself, his account of Mauritius, where the ship stopped, saw the appearance of Muslim lascars.

entries.meaning: (Anglo-Indian) A tent-pitcher; also a type of artilleryman.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the Asian genera Pantoporia and Lasippa.
